title: Greetings in Siswati| Learn to Speak Siswati| Swazi Youtuber |Siswati Corner
content: Hello, friend! today we are going to learn how to say hello! and how to say, "How are you?" in Siswati today we are going to learn to greet in Siswati So, if this friend sees another friend and they want to greet each other this one says, "Sawubona!" this one says, "Yebo!" so that's how you greet your friend now if it is many people if it is many people, you say... "Sanibonani!" they will say, "Yebo!" and then now if you want to ask your friend how they are doing you say "Unjani?" this friend responds and says "Ngiyaphila!" "Unjani wena?" "I'm fine! How are you?" and this one can respond and say "Ngiyaphila nami." I'm also well or they can just say, "Ngiyaphila." "I'm fine" ok so if you get on the phone and you are talking to your gogo your grandma what do you say as a greeting? "Sawubona, gogo!" "Sawubona, gogo!" "Unjani, gogo?" and gogo, your grandma will respond and say "Ngiyaphila!" "Ngiyaphila!" if you are talking to your aunty you can say "Sawubona, anti" and your aunty will respond and say "Yebo!" and you can say "Unjani, anti?" "How are you?" and aunty responds "Ngiyaphila" and then when it is time to go you say "Sala kahle!" it it's one person if it is more than one person you say "Salani kahle!" "Remain well!" and they say "Hamba kahle!" "Go well!" "Hamba kahle!" so that's how you say "Hello!" in Siswati and "How are you?"
